item.title: Install Repository
item.description: Bootstrap cat << 'EOF' | sudo tee /etc/yum.repos.d/staker.repo [staker] name=Mr Staker rpm repository baseurl=https://rpm.staker.ltd/$basearch/ gpgkey=https://keybase.io/saltwaterc/pgp_keys.asc?fingerprint=8E0D38C40089F860005989ACFD6652320303527F gpgcheck=1 repo_gpgcheck=1 enabled=1 EOF Install repository package sudo yum -y install staker-repo The repository package bundles the following: Exported GPG public key used by yum and rpm to verify the repository metadata signature and packages signatures. A configuration file /etc/yum.repos.d/staker.repo which shall be updated in the future to do our key rotation process.

item.title: Uninstall Repository
item.description: Procedure We’re sorry to see you go. Please provide feedback if you ran into difficulties and this is the reason for removing our package builds. We make it easy for you to remove everything: sudo yum remove staker-repo That’s it. It removes all our packages, GPG public key exports, and configuration files. It won’t remove the configuration files which you created as we have no way of tracking that.
